value.title: Showing an alternate text when no data available in a Power BI chart visuals
value.excerpt: If you have a visual in the Power BI, that based on some selections of a slicer it might return nothing, depends on the visual, you might get a blank visual or some other types of improper view. In this video, I share a simple trick that you can use to have an alternate message in those scenarios. Read

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Create dashboards in Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft Power BI dashboards are different than Power BI reports. Dashboards allow report consumers to create a single artifact of directed data that is personalized just for them.  Dashboards can be comprised of pinned visuals that are taken from different reports. Where a Power BI report uses data from a single dataset, a Power BI dashboard can contain visuals from different datasets.

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.

value.title: Price Prediction with Python and Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a machine learning price prediction using Python machine learning linear regression model and a dataset of 54,000 diamonds. This will be ported over to Power BI for a deeper level of interaction.  You can find the files and dataset here: https://github.com/Gaelim/Diamond-Price-Prediction
